content:
ADODC Class

In this Article

Provides compatibility with the Visual Basic 6.0 ADO Data Control, which enabled you to create a connection to a database using Microsoft ActiveX Data Objects (ADO).

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Obsolete("Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.* classes are obsolete and supported within 32 bit processes only. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=160862")]
public class ADODC : System.Windows.Forms.UserControl, msdatasrc.DataSource

  • Component
  • Control
  • ScrollableControl
  • ContainerControl
  • System.Windows.Forms.UserControl

Remarks

Use this control in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0 to continue to use an ADO data connection. For new development, you should consider using ADO.NET instead of ADO. For more information, see Comparison of ADO.NET and ADO.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Constructors summary

ADODC()

Initializes a new instance of the ADODC class.

Properties summary

BackColor

Gets or sets the background color for a ADODC.
BOF

Gets a value that indicates whether the current row position is before the first row in a crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset*.
BOFAction

Gets or sets a value that indicates what action the ADODC takes when the crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.BOF* property is true.
CacheSize

Gets or sets the number of records that are cached in local memory for the current crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset*.
CommandTimeout

Gets or sets the duration, in seconds, that the ADODC waits for a command to return from the server.
CommandType

Gets or sets a value that informs the ADODC what type of command to pass when opening a crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset*.
ConnectionString

Gets of sets the information that is used to establish a connection to a data source.
ConnectionTimeout

Gets or sets the duration of time, in seconds, for which the provider attempts to connect to the server specified in the crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.ConnectionString* property.
CursorLocation

Gets or sets the location of the cursor library for the ADODC object.
CursorType

Gets or sets a value that specifies the default type of cursor to use when opening a result set from the specified query.
EOF

Gets a value that indicates whether the current row position is after the last row in a crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset*.
EOFAction

Gets or sets a value that indicates what action the ADODC takes when the crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.EOF* property is true.
LockType

Gets or sets a value that indicates the type of concurrency handling.
MaxRecords

Gets or sets the maximum number of records that can be retrieved from the data source.
Mode

Gets or sets a value that specifies the available permissions for modifying data in a Connection or opening a Record in a ADODC.
Orientation

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether a ADODC will be oriented horizontally (the default) or vertically.
Password

Sets the password that is used during the creation of an ADO Recordset object.
Recordset

Gets or sets a reference to the underlying ADO Recordset object.
RecordSource

Gets or sets the statement or query that returns a crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset*.
Text

Gets or sets the text that is contained in the display area of a ADODC.
UserName

Gets or sets a value that represents a user of an ADO Recordset object.

Methods summary

addDataSourceListener(DataSourceListener)

Adds an interface to monitor changes in a data set.
Dispose(Boolean)

Releases the unmanaged resources used by a ADODC and optionally releases the managed resources.

Returns a crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset* for a ADODC.

Implements the OLE DB DataSource.getDataMemberCount method.

Implements the OLE DB DataSource.getDataMemberName method.

Raises the Resize event.
Refresh()

Forces a control to invalidate its client area and immediately redraw itself and any child controls.
removeDataSourceListener(DataSourceListener)

Removes a DataSourceListener.

Events summary

EndOfRecordset

The EndOfRecordset event is called when there is an attempt to move to a row past the end of the crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset*.
Error

Occurs when an exception is raised in a ADODC.
FetchComplete

Occurs when a ADODC control completes a fetch from a database.
FetchProgress

Occurs while a ADODC control is fetching data from a database.
FieldChangeComplete

Occurs when an update to a Field in a crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset* for a ADODC control is complete.
MoveComplete

Occurs when a MoveFirst, MoveNext, or MoveLast method has occurred in a Recordset for a ADODC control.
RecordChangeComplete

Occurs when the current record has changed in the Recordset of a ADODC control.
RecordsetChangeComplete

Occurs when the Recordset for a ADODC control changes.
WillChangeField

Occurs before the current field in a Recordset of a ADODC control changes.
WillChangeRecord

Occurs before the current record in a Recordset of a ADODC control changes.
WillChangeRecordset

Occurs before the Recordset of a ADODC control changes.
WillMove

Occurs before the MoveFirst, MoveNext, or MoveLast method of a Recordset of a ADODC control executes.

Constructors

  • ADODC()

    Initializes a new instance of the ADODC class.

    public ADODC ();

    Remarks

    Provides compatibility with the Visual Basic 6.0 ADO Data Control.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Properties

  • BackColor

    Gets or sets the background color for a ADODC.

    public override System.Drawing.Color BackColor { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Color

      A Color that represents the background color of the ADODC.

    Remarks

    Setting the BackColor property affects only the part of the control where text is displayed.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • BOF

    Gets a value that indicates whether the current row position is before the first row in a crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset*.

    public bool BOF { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the current row position is before the first row; otherwise false.

    Remarks

    The BOF and EOF return values are determined by the location of the current row pointer if this pointer is valid. If either BOF or EOF is true, there is no current row, and any attempt to reference Recordset data causes an exception.

    You can use the BOF and EOF properties to determine whether an Recordset object contains rows or whether you have gone beyond the limits of an Recordset as you move from row to row.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • BOFAction

    Gets or sets a value that indicates what action the ADODC takes when the crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.BOF* property is true.

    public Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.BOFActionEnum BOFAction { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ADODC+BOFActionEnum

      A ADODC+BOFActionEnum enumeration that specifies the action to take.

    Remarks

    Use this property to specify the behavior when the MovePrevious button is pressed and the first row of a Recordset is the current row.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • CacheSize

    Gets or sets the number of records that are cached in local memory for the current crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset*.

    public int CacheSize { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      An Integer that specifies the number of records that are cached in local memory for the current crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset* object. The default is 50 records.

    Remarks

    The CacheSize value tells the provider how many records to keep in its buffer and how many records to fetch at one time to local memory. For example, when set to 10, after opening the first Recordset, the provider fetches the first 10 records into local memory. Therefore, as you move forward from the current record, the provider returns the data values from the local memory buffer. As soon as you move past the last record, the next 10 records are fetched from the data source into the cache.

    While you can change value during the life of the cursor, the change only affects the number of records in the cache after the next fetch from the data source.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • CommandTimeout

    Gets or sets the duration, in seconds, that the ADODC waits for a command to return from the server.

    public int CommandTimeout { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      An Integer that specifies the number of seconds to wait when a connection is being established. The default is 15 seconds.

    Remarks

    After this period of time has elapsed without completing the command, the provider raises an exception to the calling application and cancels the command.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • CommandType

    Gets or sets a value that informs the ADODC what type of command to pass when opening a crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset*.

    public ADODB.CommandTypeEnum CommandType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ADODB.CommandTypeEnum

      A ADODB.CommandTypeEnum enumeration that specifies the command type.

    Remarks

    Setting this property optimizes the execution of the command.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • ConnectionString

    Gets of sets the information that is used to establish a connection to a data source.

    public string ConnectionString { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A String that contains the connection information.

    Remarks

    Use the ConnectionString property to specify a data source by passing a detailed connection string that contains a series of argument = value statements separated by semicolons.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • ConnectionTimeout

    Gets or sets the duration of time, in seconds, for which the provider attempts to connect to the server specified in the crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.ConnectionString* property.

    public int ConnectionTimeout { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      An Integer that specifies the number of seconds to wait when a connection is being established. The default is 15 seconds.

    Remarks

    This property corresponds to the ADO ConnectionTimeout property.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • CursorLocation

    Gets or sets the location of the cursor library for the ADODC object.

    public ADODB.CursorLocationEnum CursorLocation { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ADODB.CursorLocationEnum

      A ADODB.CursorLocationEnum enumeration that specifies s the location. The default is ADODB.CursorLocationEnum.adUseClient.

    Remarks

    This property corresponds to the ADO Command and Connection CursorLocation property.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • CursorType

    Gets or sets a value that specifies the default type of cursor to use when opening a result set from the specified query.

    public ADODB.CursorTypeEnum CursorType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ADODB.CursorTypeEnum

      A ADODB.CursorTypeEnum enumeration that specifies the type of cursor to use.

    Remarks

    Determines the cursor type to use when opening a Recordset.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • EOF

    Gets a value that indicates whether the current row position is after the last row in a crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset*.

    public bool EOF { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the current row position is after the last row; otherwise false.

    Remarks

    The BOF and EOF return values are determined by the location of the current row pointer if this pointer is valid. If either BOF or EOF is true, there is no current row, and any attempt to reference Recordset data causes an exception.

    You can use the BOF and EOF properties to determine whether an Recordset object contains rows or whether you have gone beyond the limits of an Recordset as you move from row to row.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • EOFAction

    Gets or sets a value that indicates what action the ADODC takes when the crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.EOF* property is true.

    public Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.EOFActionEnum EOFAction { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ADODC+EOFActionEnum

      A ADODC+EOFActionEnum enumeration that specifies the action to take.

    Remarks

    Use this property to specify the behavior when the MoveNext button is pressed when the first row of a Recordset is the current row.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • LockType

    Gets or sets a value that indicates the type of concurrency handling.

    public ADODB.LockTypeEnum LockType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ADODB.LockTypeEnum

      A ADODB.LockTypeEnum enumeration that specifies the type of concurrency handling.

    Remarks

    In order to maintain sufficient control over the data being updated, ADO provides a number of concurrency options that control how other users are granted, or refused access to the data being updated.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • Dispose(Boolean)

    Releases the unmanaged resources used by a ADODC and optionally releases the managed resources.

    protected override void Dispose (bool disposing);

    Parameters

    • disposing
      Boolean

      true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

    Remarks

    This method is called by the public Dispose() method and the Finalize method. Dispose() invokes the protected Dispose(Boolean) method with the disposing parameter set to true. Finalize invokes Dispose with the disposing parameter set to false.

    When the disposing parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this control references. This method invokes the Dispose() method of each referenced object.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.
